main_text.sentence: This may imply that Tat can still transactivate in the absence of PKR phosphorylation, although at much reduced efficiency, and/or that the protein may be phosphorylated by other kinases at other sites, for example, PKC which phosphorylates Tat at S46 [38].

Interestingly, phosphorylated HIV-1 Rev protein has been shown to bind RNA seven times more strongly than non-phosphorylated protein, and the non-phosphorylated Rev-RNA complex dissociates 1.6 times more rapidly than the phosphorylated complex [32].

Although RHII/Gu was found to associate with phosphorylated c-Jun in a non-phosphorylated state, this association was observed to increase after anisomycin treatment, implying a stronger interaction when c-Jun is phosphorylated [4].
Moreover, MKK7, like MKK4, phosphorylates JNK [40].
In the Drosophila NMJ, active CamKII phosphorylates DLG [19].
CKII was also reported to phosphorylate the C2 component (α6 subunit) in rice [26].
It was also known that CaMKII phosphorylates synapsin I [28,29].
In the yeast 20S proteasome, the α2- and α4-subunits are phosphorylated at either a serine or threonine residue, and the α7-subunit is phosphorylated at tyrosine residue(s) [20].
PKA can phosphorylate CBP directly or other components of the transcriptional machinery downstream from CREB [32,33].

source_text.title: In vitro phosphorylation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 Tat protein by protein kinase C: evidence for the phosphorylation of amino acid residue serine-46
Site-specific phosphorylation of the human immunodeficiency virus type-1 Rev protein accelerates formation of an efficient RNA-binding conformation
The DEXD/H-box RNA helicase RHII/Gu is a co-factor for c-Jun-activated transcription
The MKK7 gene encodes a group of c-Jun NH2-terminal kinase kinases
Regulation of DLG localization at synapses by CaMKII-dependent phosphorylation
Phosphorylation of the C2 subunit of the proteasome in rice (Oryza sativa L.)
Intraterminal injection of synapsin I or calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II alters neurotransmitter release at the squid giant synapse
Characterization of synapsin I binding to small synaptic vesicles
Electrophoretic analysis of phosphorylation of the yeast 20S proteasome
A novel mechanism for cyclic adenosine 3',5'-monophosphate regulation of gene expression by CREB-binding protein
